captions.text: That's my fault
Yo I miss you I wish we come back
I can’t do anything without you
It has to be you

You are getting farther as time 
goes by,I can’t breathe god them

I blame the heaven for 
letting me into despair

I regretted it the moment
I let you go

People told me to 
never let you go

That she is one of a kind and
There is no one like her

It hurts way too much, 
it's like a penalty

I am punished for 
what I've done wrong
I regret many times everyday

At night tears keep 
falling and I cry(I cry)
Only you can cure it

That you are seeing someone 
else,You are doing well

They are all lies,Please don’t 
be happy without me

Makes me cry makes me cry 
I can’t live a day without you
It’s all my fault

Yo You disappear 
from the photo

It’s my mistake thinking 
that it’ll get better
I hope you are happy

I hope you are happy 
But my heart doesn't change
I want to be with you

I call you but there 
is no answer
But still I don’t wanna let go

Now I am alone don’t 
wanna be alone

I don’t know if you will forgive 
me if I beg for mercy
I don't know

It hurts way too much, 
It's like a penalty

I am punished for 
what I’ve done wrong
I regret many times everyday

At night tears keep 
falling and I cry(I cry)
Only you can cure it

That you are seeing someone else 
You are doing well

They are all lies 
Please don’t be happy without me

Makes me cry makes me cry 
I can’t live a day without you
It’s all my fault

I see your back, leaving me 
I think this might be right

Although it hurts it makes my
heart relief

It makes me regret not 
having been good to you

I couldn't give you 
even a small present

I keep crying 
Does this make sense?
We can never meet again

Love stories like a dream 
are not going to happen

Now I am alone 
don’t wanna be alone

I don’t know if you will 
forgive me if I beg for mercy
I don’t know

That you are seeing someone else 
You are doing well
They are all lies

Please don’t be happy without me 
Makes me cry makes me cry

I can’t live a day without you
It’s all my fault

comments.author: Bea jjengex

comments.text:
No one finds setting the music video of a cheesy love song to a real, 
infamous massacre in Gwangju at all upsetting?  They used the setting 
solely to make themselves look bad-ass and exploit a really tragic period 
of South Korean history (which is still fresh in the minds of many here, I 
assure you).  Hundreds were killed by their own military, mostly university 
students.  Show some damn respect for your own country's people.  This 
video and Speed have zero class.﻿
comments.author: Ticalmc2k2

comments.text: DAFUQ?
comments.author: TheQueenJiyeon

comments.text:
I don't think they chose the setting to be disrespectful, they chose it 
according to the song's meaning, and to me, the scenes represent 
sacrificing for your loved ones, and it helps me connect a lot more to the 
song, to be honest. It gives it more of a personal feel because I recognize 
the setting and the history of what had happened. ^^ Even though I just 
recently discovered SPEED, please don't give up on them because of one MV~

comments.author: JustMyStyle

comments.text:
+JustMyStyle Actually it's not exactly under marshal law. After Korea war 
(in 50s), S.Korea next president ran the country like police-state. He was 
forced to resign by student uprising, but a military general took over by 
force, pushed through amendment to constitution to end S.Korea democracy 
election, making himself a dictator. After 10 years, he got assassinated by 
yet another military general, who also became another dictator. In the 80s, 
S.Koreans demanded democracy, revolted and lead to Gwangju uprising. The 
new dictator ordered Gwangju massacre (as depicted in this MV), using tanks 
and military to shoot at crowds, killing 300 people and injured by 
thousands, completely crushed the revolts. This, however, forced the 
dictatorship to change back to democracy election. Conclusion: S.Korea 
politics are a complete mess.
comments.author: Thomas Anderson

comments.text:
+JustMyStyle Then you will like both drama versions... are pretty good and 
I love it...
comments.author: CoolGirlNiceWoman

comments.text:
I like it. The video is interesting. It made me think. South Korea was 
under Martial Law from the Korean War until the early 1990's. I wonder how 
life was then. Idols would not know, but their parents would.
